review.title: Proactive Decision Support using Automated Planning
review.abstract: Proactive decision support (PDS) helps in improving the decision making experience of human decision makers in human-in-the-loop planning environments. Here both the quality of the decisions and the ease of making them are enhanced. In this regard, we propose a PDS framework, named RADAR, based on the research in Automated Planning in AI, that aids the human decision maker with her plan to achieve her goals by providing alerts on: whether such a plan can succeed at all, whether there exist any resource constraints that may foil her plan, etc. This is achieved by generating and analyzing the landmarks that must be accomplished by any successful plan on the way to achieving the goals. Note that, this approach also supports naturalistic decision making which is being acknowledged as a necessary element in proactive decision support, since it only aids the human decision maker through suggestions and alerts rather than enforcing fixed plans or decisions. We demonstrate the utility of the proposed framework through search-and-rescue examples in a fire-fighting domain.

sections.heading: PROPOSED PROACTIVE DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEM: RADAR
sections.text: Now we will briefly present the proposed Proactive Decision Support System (PDS) - RADAR, based on automated planning technologies. First, we will introduce the various elements of the PDS system and then briefly present the details of the methodology behind the creation of proposals and warnings. The various elements of the Planning PDS system are: • Tasks / Goals: The tasks or goals that need to be achieved clearly represent an important and necessary element. • State / Context, Resources: The current state or context is needed for the PDS system to generate relevant warnings. Resource availability is also part of the context that we separately point out as an important part of the context. • Model, Measures / Decisions: The model consists of rules that are applicable in the world in which the plan is being executed. Measures are, for example, part of a model that provides information about when a particular measure is applicable (which are the conditions that need to be met in order for the current state to be achieved), what impact that measure may have.

sections.heading: Generating Suggestions and Alerts (PDS)
sections.text: Since the boundary stones are the states that need to be visited in order to achieve the objectives, if there is no way to reach a particular boundary, the system can generate an alarm that signals that the target cannot be achieved, perhaps because there are no measures available to help with the visit to the boundary in question, or because the conditions for measures that can help to reach the boundary are not met. In some cases, the conditions that are not currently met for a measure to be applicable may be due to resource constraints. In such cases, the system instead generates a suggestion that these resources are needed to accomplish the task.

sections.heading: CONCLUSION
sections.text: We presented a Proactive Decision Support Framework (PDS) called RADAR, which is based on research on automated planning in the field of artificial intelligence and supports the human decision maker in her plan to achieve her goals by providing warnings and suggestions on possible drawbacks in the plan and resource constraints, by identifying and analysing the milestones that a successful plan needs to achieve before the goals are achieved. The proposed approach is consistent with the concept of naturalistic decision-making, and we demonstrated the usefulness of the proposed framework using search and rescue examples in the field of firefighting and studies on human factors.
